messages.title: Martin Says...
messages.content: The reason we've become the loudest, most progressive voice in Shepway is because we don't just pop up at election times and ask for your vote. We campaign throughout the year. We back local residents and groups at every opportunity. Our councillors at all levels of local government listen and respond to everyone that contacts them. Shouldn't all our elected representatives do this? We can bring the change that is desperately needed, but not without your help. Without change at the ballot box, the Tories will feel they have a mandate to continue cutting funding from front-line services and concreting over our open spaces and countryside.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Greens will ensure that when you rent a home, you feel at home. We will introduce rent controls to ensure that no one is forced to accept huge increases in their rent every year.
We must use Britain’s wealth to invest in funding for the NHS, plug the deficit in funding that’s been created, and plant the seeds for new and flourishing public health services.
We want young people to be asked, not told, listened to, not ignored, to be inspired by their futures, not bored by school. Scrapping the tuition fees that stop so many off studying for a degree.

A democracy worthy of the name gives people a real say. The Green Party will hold a referendum on Brexit once the terms of a deal have been agreed with the EU. That referendum will give the public two clear choices: accept the Brexit deal negotiated or remain an EU member.
It’s not fun and it’s not pretty but it’s a must: we must liberate ourselves from the threat of climate change. By investing in renewables and banning fracking.

mentions.tacticalSituation: In Shepway, as the other opposition parties have fallen away, the Green Party has emerged as the main threat to the Tories. In We might only be here because the Tory tide at the polls faltered in May and achieved a higher percentage of the vote across the district than any other opposition party. Want to vote tactically? Vote Green.
